purpose.text: Defines what the Codex is, how it governs Skyesoft, and how AI interacts with human-approved doctrine.

title.text: Meta Principle — The Codex as Instruction

codexAsBrain.text: Skyesoft is codex-driven. The SSE provides real-time data, but the Codex defines how all modules interpret and present that data. All system logic derives from Codex standards, not hardcoded rules.

dataVsInstruction.text: The SSE is the source of truth for live data. The Codex is the source of truth for how that data must be used, displayed, or processed. This separation maintains clarity, safety, and consistency.

aiAugmentation.text: AI enhances interpretation, writing, lookup, and workflow guidance. AI may recommend, summarize, or detect inconsistencies, but may not create binding rules or alter Codex doctrine.

title.text: Meta Principle — Single Source of Truth

singleSourceOfTruth.text: All rule logic, formatting standards, and validation procedures must reside in the Codex. The system must not introduce new rules through scripts, chat logs, or external documents.

iconMapping.text: All Codex objects must reference icons by numeric ID from iconMap.json. Emoji literals or PNG names are prohibited. This supports validation and consistent rendering across reports and UI modules.

structureHierarchy.text: The Codex is organized into: Tier 0 Meta, Tier 1 Constitution, Tier 2 Standards, and Tier 3 Modules. Each tier derives authority from the one above it and may not exceed its scope.

renderSpacingStandard.text: All Codex text blocks are authored as single-spaced. Rendering engines producing HTML, PDF, or Sheets must preserve single-spacing unless a documentStandard explicitly requires multi-spacing. This ensures consistent, compact, professional output.

humanAuthority.text: Skyesoft is governed by human decision-makers. AI may assist, recommend, and evaluate, but may not create binding rules. All Codex changes require explicit human approval.

title.text: Article II — The Codex as the Source of Truth

codexIsLaw.text: The Codex defines how Skyesoft interprets data, renders documents, and governs system behaviors. When code and Codex disagree, the Codex prevails. The SSE provides real-time data; the Codex provides the instructions for how to use it.

systemGovernance.text: Tier 2 Standards establish the rules and procedures for categories of functionality. Tier 3 Modules must follow all Standards and may not override them. Standards may be amended only through a ratified Parliamentarian ruling.

consistencyDoctrine.text: All Skyesoft outputs—including reports, documents, and validations—must follow shared visual, structural, and procedural standards. No module may create its own formatting or rules outside the Codex.

parliamentarianAuthority.text: The Parliamentarian interprets Codex Standards, resolves contradictions, and issues formal rulings. Rulings clarify the Codex but do not replace it unless explicitly marked as amendments.

archivistRole.text: The Archivist records all amendments, rulings, and version changes. No rule is valid unless archived. The Archivist ensures historical continuity and prevents unintentional drift or duplication.

title.text: Article VII — Data Streams and Real-Time Truth

sseDoctrine.text: The SSE stream provides authoritative, real-time data to Skyesoft systems. Modules may not create their own truths, timestamps, or weather data. All live data must come from the SSE.

noShadowRules.text: Rules may not exist outside the Codex. Chat discussions, emails, comments, or code comments do not establish policy. Only Codex entries and Parliamentarian rulings form legitimate governance.

title.text: Article IX — Safety and Operational Compliance

safeOperation.text: All system behavior must align with the operational needs of a sign company. AI must prioritize clarity, safety, compliance, and professional workflows. Overly academic or speculative reasoning is prohibited in official operations.

amendmentProcess.text: Changes to the Codex must pass through: (1) Proposal, (2) Parliamentarian Review, (3) Human Approval, (4) Archivist Recording. No other path may modify the Codex.
